comments.content:
I don't know if this monogram is produced by a digital font. Date and source of image would help.  
For a digital font that can produce monograms with a similar formal swirl effect I suggest Antoinette Monogrammes:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/antoinette-monogrammes/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061135/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/antoinette-monogrammes/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/antoinette-monogrammes/")  
If you can do a little additional work to make monograms here are some vertical swirl scripts that could produce a nice result:  
Sweet Upright Script:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/upright-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061135/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/upright-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/upright-script/")  
Valentine:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/valentine/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061135/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/valentine/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/valentine/")  
Stradivarius:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/stradivarius/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061135/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/stradivarius/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/stradivarius/")

Don

The font used was Harold Lohner's [Vine Monograms](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061135/http:/www.fontbros.com/families/vine-monograms/?code=harold). I thought that last letter was a 'C', but it's not - it's an 'L'. Read the PDF manual and then use the Testdrive.

I can't imagine having made such a set of 6 fonts as all combinations of letters must work well together and each font contains characters for three different styles of frame.
